name: Christmas Gift Pack *** Five Edition Collection *** 50% saving
description: Once again it's time for our Christmas gift-pack special... the complete suite of five editions: an ideal present for your pub-loving loved one, best friend, work colleague, or someone down your local. As we're getting into the festive spirit we are offering this gift-pack of five editions at a cracking price of £11.99, saving you just over 50%. This gift-pack will be dispatched immediately, up until December 18th (UK), 10th for the rest of the world. Any orders taken after these dates will be mailed, but will not be guaranteed to arrive in time for Christmas. Cheers. ------------------------------------------- If you encounter any problems using this store, or would like some help with your order, please do get in touch: editor@doghousemagazine.co.uk

name: Doghouse – Edition #5
description: Edition #5 of Doghouse is our Birmingham edition... which, to slightly confuse matters, actually starts in the Welsh/English border town of Rhayader: home to the Lion Royal Hotel, and the Elan Valley reservoirs, which supply Birmingham its water. Following the 73-mile pipeline the best we can, stopping at a number of pubs along the way, we eventually start our city crawl in Harborne; later taking in Moseley, Hockley, Nechells, Digbeth and the city centre. We also welcome this edition's regular, Tony, who remembers leaving school, the day a sheet glass got stuck in the back of a chap's neck, and a good joke about a seaman. FEATURED PUBS ​1. Bell Inn, Harborne 2. British Oak, Stirchley 3. Prince of Wales, Moseley 4. Old Joint Stock, centre 5. Wellington, centre 6. Old Contemptibles, centre 7. Bartons Arms, Aston 8. Bull Ring Tavern, Digbeth 9. White Swan, Digbeth 10. The Anchor, Digbeth 11. Fountain, Digbeth 12. Craven Arms, Gough Street 13. Rose Villa Tavern, Hockley 14. Jewellers Arms, Hockley 15. Black Eagle, Hockley 16. Villa Tavern, Nechells ------------------------------------------- 84 pages 210 x 274mm Perfect-bound Printed in the UK on 115gsm ------------------------------------------- If you encounter any problems using this store, or would like some help with your order, please do get in touch: editor@doghousemagazine.co.uk

name: Doghouse – Edition #4
description: Edition #4 of Doghouse starts with a pint of Arkell's 3B and a championship round of skittles in Cheltenham, followed by a 20-mile radius of public houses... Cirencester in one direction; Worcester in another. We also welcome this edition's regular, Aubrey, who relives Raiders of the Lost Ark, being manhandled in a gents toilet, and teaching Richard Gere how to play darts. FEATURED PUBS ​1. Black Horse, Cranham 2. Brewers Arms, West Malvern 3. The Plough, Worcester 4. Three Kings, Hanley Castle 5. Adam & Eve, Cheltenham 6. Butchers Arms, Eldersfield 7. Red Lion, Ampney St Peter 8. Tunnel House, Coates 9. Daneway, Sapperton 10. Five Mile House, Duntisbourne Abbots ------------------------------------------- 84 pages 210 x 274mm Perfect-bound Printed in the UK on 115gsm ------------------------------------------- If you encounter any problems using this store, or would like some help with your order, please do get in touch: editor@doghousemagazine.co.uk

name: Doghouse – Edition #3
description: Issue #3 of Doghouse starts with a round of bitter and mild in Stourbridge before careering around a 10-mile radius of surrounding pubs.​ We match-make cheese with beer, remember Wolverhampton Wanderers beating Arsenal 5.1 in the snow, and find the pub Mad King Ludwig II of Bavaria would loved to have called his local. We also welcome regular, Douglas, who tells of ladies hairdressing, throwing grenades, and a relative who frequently carried a cart horse. FEATURED PUBS ​1. Britannia, Upper Gornal 2. Old Swan, Netherton 3. Waggon & Horses, Halesowen 4. Waggon & Horses, Oldbury 5. Shakespeare, Dudley 6. Beacon Hotel, Sedgley 7. Royal Exchange, Stourbridge 8. King & Castle, Kidderminster 9. Black Boy, Bewdley 10. Railwaymans Arms, Bridgnorth 11. Unicorn Inn, Hampton Loade 12. Harbour Inn, Arley 13. Great Western, Wolverhampton 14. Crooked House, Himley 15. Bottle & Glass, Dudley ------------------------------------------- 84 pages 210 x 274mm Perfect-bound Printed in the UK on 115gsm ------------------------------------------- POSTAGE IS ONLY £1.00 ON THIS PARTICULAR EDITION (RESTRICTED TO UK ORDERS ONLY) DUE TO THE OCCASIONAL MAGAZINE COPY FOUND TO FEATURE PRINTING INK MARKINGS. ..NOTHING SERIOUS JUST NOT PERFECT. ------------------------------------------- If you encounter any problems using this store, or would like some help with your order, please do get in touch: editor@doghousemagazine.co.uk

name: Doghouse – Edition #2
description: Issue #2 of Doghouse starts with a hearty breakfast in Hay-on-Wye before embarking on a 20-mile radius tour of surrounding pubs and cafes.​ We also experience a spot of tennis from within the pubs of Wimbledon and a rare and exclusive floor-by-floor study of Britain's oldest licensed brewery. We also welcome columnist: Roy. FEATURED PUBS ​1. The Griffin, Llyswen 2. Three Horse Shoes, Norton Canon 3. The Victory, Hereford 4. Bowling Green, Hereford 5. The Barrels, Hereford 6. Pandy Inn, Dorstone 7. Rhydspense Inn, Whitney-On-Wye 8. Yew Tree, Preston-On-Wye 9. Nags Head, Peterchurch 10. Cornewall Arms, Clodock 11. Carpenters Arms, Walterstone 12. Swan Inn, Huntington 13. The Dog Inn, Ewyas Harold 14. Temple Bar, Ewyas Harold 16. Olde Tavern, Kington 17. New Inn, Pembridge 18. Royal Oak, Gladestry FEATURED CAFES 1. Bus Station Cafe, Hereford 2. Regency Cafe, Kington 3. Coronation Cafe, Talgarth 4. Hay's Kitchen, Hay-on-Wye 5. Rich Way Cafe, Brecon ------------------------------------------- 100 pages 210 x 274mm Perfect-bound Printed in the UK on 115gsm ------------------------------------------- If you encounter any problems using this store, or would like some help with your order, please do get in touch: editor@doghousemagazine.co.uk

name: Doghouse – Edition #1
description: Welcome to our first edition, launched on May 10th, 2012. As well as our 10-mile radius pub crawl starting in Shropshire's Ludlow, we investigate beer vending machines, pop into a few cafes, and head to a Grade II-listed pub for a rap battle. FEATURED PUBS 1. Village hall, Ashford Carbonell 2. Ludlow Brewing Co, Ludlow 3. Grape Vaults, Leominster 4. The Chequers, Leominster 5. The Church Inn, Ludlow 6. The Feathers Hotel, Ludlow 7. The Blue Boar, Ludlow 8. The Wheatsheaf, Ludlow 9. Charlton Arms, Ludlow 10. Rose & Crown, Ludlow 11. Rose & Crown, Tenbury 12. The Ship, Tenbury 13. The Pembroke, Tenbury 14. The Vaults, Tenbury 15. The Peacock, Tenbury 16. Riverside Inn, Aymestrey 17. The Boot Inn, Orleton 18. The Bell, Yarpole 19. Sun Inn, Leintwardine ------------------------------------------- 100 pages 210 x 274mm Perfect-bound Printed in the UK on 115gsm ------------------------------------------- If you encounter any problems using this store, or would like some help with your order, please do get in touch: editor@doghousemagazine.co.uk

name: 4-issue pack
description: Receive four editions of Doghouse magazine and make a saving of £3.96. Editions #1 through to #5 will be dispatched immediately, in one shipment. Edition #6 is currently in production and is scheduled for release in October. Thank you for your support. Happy reading. ------------------------------------------- If you encounter any problems using this store, or would like some help with your order, please do get in touch: editor@doghousemagazine.co.uk

name: The Battle Illustration
description: We have 149 of these limited edition prints. Printed on 285gsm Hahnemühle Fine Art Pearl, they measure 420mm wide x 530mm tall in size. Each print is accompanied by a certificate of authenticity; hand-numbered and signed by the artist. Created by Doghouse illustrator Sean Sims, to illustrate Mark Dredge's moan about the whole 'cask/craft' debate going on in the UK at the moment... featured in edition #5 of Doghouse. "There’s in-fighting in what should be a close industry and somehow the discussion has evolved into this thing which is a monster of misunderstanding; which like a game of Chinese whispers is turning into a controversy of untruths and assumptions." ------------------------------------------- If you encounter any problems using this store, or would like some help with your order, please do get in touch: editor@doghousemagazine.co.uk

name: Sprog & Dog Illustration
description: We have 149 of these limited edition prints. Printed on 285gsm Hahnemühle Fine Art Pearl, they measure 420mm wide x 530mm tall in size. Each print is accompanied by a certificate of authenticity; hand-numbered and signed by the artist. Created by Doghouse illustrator Sean Sims, to illustrate Keith Wildman's debate-making rant about children and the British pub... featured in edition #4 of Doghouse. "Not too long ago, in my local – which clearly has a sign by each door stating that children under 18 are not allowed in after 7pm – a woman came in with a toddler around half 7. When told there were no children allowed, she turned on her heels and bellowed with disgust: “What is this, the middle ages or summat?” No love if it was the middle ages your kid would either be doing something useful like ploughing a field or more than likely bedridden with consumption; not disturbing me whilst I’m enjoying a nice pint of Ossett Silver King." ------------------------------------------- If you encounter any problems using this store, or would like some help with your order, please do get in touch: editor@doghousemagazine.co.uk

name: Digital Edition (Doghouse #5) PDF download
description:
High-resolution 84-page 25MB single PDF/digital document, presented in double-page format, as it is in the printed version.

Once your order is complete you will shortly receive a download email courtesy of WeTransfer.

This will not at all replace the printed version, instead an option for those who may prefer a different format. There are, however, no real plans to go truly tablet/mobile, so this PDF offering is probably about as tech as Doghouse will ever go...

name: Digital Edition (Doghouse #4) PDF download
description:
It has long been suggested that Doghouse should be offered in a digital format, so to trial the interest/demand, we have dipped our toe in the water with a PDF download of edition #4. 

The product is a high-resolution 86-page 25MB single PDF document, presented in double-page format, as it is in the printed version. 

Once your order is complete you will shortly receive a download email courtesy of WeTransfer.

This will not at all replace the printed version, instead an option for those who may prefer a different format. There are, however, no real plans to go truly tablet/mobile, so this PDF offering is probably about as tech as Doghouse will ever go...

name: Beer Mood Button (4 pack)
description:
This handy little four-pack of button badges – created exclusively for Doghouse magazine – will hopefully go a little way to help illustrate your mood – whether you really do swing from being dark to pale; from bitter to mild, or if they simply reflect your drink of choice.

Perfect gift, or personal mood reflector. 

Classic 1-inch (25mm)
Metal construction
Made in the UK

name: 2013 Doghouse Calendar
description: The 2013 Doghouse calendar features glorious 12-inch square photography from photographers Gavin Weston and Richard Stanton, from editions one, two and three. 300mm x 300mm (closed) 305mm x 610mm (open) Centrally spiral-bound, which just requires a couple of drawing pins to tack it to your wall, door or notice board. ------------------------------------------- If you encounter any problems using this store, or would like some help with your order, please do get in touch: editor@doghousemagazine.co.uk
